Modules/API

cxt.modules

class cxt.modules.LayerNorm(ndim: int, use_bias: bool = True)[source]

Bases: Module

Layer normalization module. :param ndim: The number of dimensions in the input tensor. :type ndim: int :param use_bias: If True, adds a learnable bias to the normalized tensor. :type use_bias: bool

weight

Learnable scaling parameter of shape (ndim,).

Type:

torch.nn.Parameter

bias

Learnable bias parameter of shape (ndim,) if bias is True, otherwise None.

Type:

torch.nn.Parameter or None

forward(input)[source]

Applies layer normalization to the input tensor. :param input: The input tensor to be normalized. :type input: torch.Tensor

Returns:

The normalized tensor.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

forward(input)[source]

Define the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

class cxt.modules.MLP(config)[source]

Bases: Module

A multi-layer perceptron (MLP) module. :param config: Configuration object containing the following attributes:

  • n_embd (int): The size of the input and output embeddings.

  • bias (bool): Whether to use bias in the linear layers.

  • dropout (float): Dropout probability.

c_fc

The first linear layer that projects the input to a higher dimension.

Type:

nn.Linear

gelu

GELU activation function.

Type:

nn.GELU

c_proj

The second linear layer that projects the higher dimension back to the original size.

Type:

nn.Linear

dropout

Dropout layer for regularization.

Type:

nn.Dropout

forward(x)[source]

Forward pass of the MLP. :param x: Input tensor. :type x: torch.Tensor

Returns:

Output tensor after applying the linear layers, activation function, and dropout.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

forward(x)[source]

Define the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

class cxt.modules.MutationsToLatentSpace(config)[source]

Bases: Module

A cache for storing and concatenating attention key/value tensors during incremental decoding. Specifically: [B, n_head, T, head_size] where:

B: batch size n_head: number of attention heads T: sequence length head_size: dimension of each attention head

Parameters:

  • max_batch_size (int) – Maximum batch size.

  • max_seq_length (int) – Maximum sequence length.

  • n_head (int) – Number of attention heads.

  • head_size (int) – Dimension of each attention head.

  • device (str or torch.device) – Device on which to allocate the tensors (e.g., “cpu” or “cuda”).

src_key_cache

Pre-allocated tensor for source keys, shape [B, n_head, max_seq_length, head_size].

Type:

torch.Tensor

src_value_cache

Pre-allocated tensor for source values, shape [B, n_head, max_seq_length, head_size].

Type:

torch.Tensor

tgt_key_cache

Pre-allocated tensor for target keys, shape [B, n_head, max_seq_length, head_size].

Type:

torch.Tensor

tgt_value_cache

Pre-allocated tensor for target values, shape [B, n_head, max_seq_length, head_size].

Type:

torch.Tensor

src_len

Number of valid tokens in the source cache.

Type:

int

tgt_len

Number of valid tokens in the target cache.

Type:

int

update_source(key, value)

Overwrites the source key/value caches with the given tensors. :param key: Source key of shape [B, n_head, s_len, head_size]. :type key: torch.Tensor :param value: Source value of shape [B, n_head, s_len, head_size]. :type value: torch.Tensor

update_target(key, value, position)

Writes the target key/value at the specified position. :param key: Target key of shape [B, n_head, 1, head_size]. :type key: torch.Tensor :param value: Target value of shape [B, n_head, 1, head_size]. :type value: torch.Tensor :param position: The position in the target cache to write to. :type position: int

get_kv(position)

Concatenates source and target key/value up to the specified target position. :param position: Target sequence position (0-based) up to which

the cache is read.

Returns:

  • key of shape [B, n_head, src_len + (position+1), head_size].

  • value of shape [B, n_head, src_len + (position+1), head_size].

Return type:

(torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor)

clear()

Resets the source and target caches to zero and sets src_len/tgt_len to 0.

forward(x)[source]

Define the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

cxt.kv_cache

class cxt.kv_cache.KVCache(max_batch_size, max_seq_length, n_head, head_size, device)[source]

Bases: object

A cache for storing and concatenating attention key/value tensors during incremental decoding (e.g., in autoregressive models).

Parameters:

  • max_batch_size (int) – Maximum batch size.

  • max_seq_length (int) – Maximum sequence length.

  • n_head (int) – Number of attention heads.

  • head_size (int) – Dimension of each attention head.

  • device (str or torch.device) – Device on which to allocate the tensors (e.g., “cpu” or “cuda”).

src_key_cache, src_value_cache

Source caches for key and value.

Type:

torch.Tensor

tgt_key_cache, tgt_value_cache

Target caches for key and value.

Type:

torch.Tensor

src_len, tgt_len

Track the number of valid tokens in the source/target caches.

Type:

int

Example

>>> kvcache = KVCache(2, 8, 2, 4, "cpu")
>>> src_k = torch.randn(2, 2, 3, 4)
>>> src_v = torch.randn(2, 2, 3, 4)
>>> kvcache.update_source(src_k, src_v)
>>> tgt_k = torch.randn(2, 2, 1, 4)
>>> tgt_v = torch.randn(2, 2, 1, 4)
>>> kvcache.update_target(tgt_k, tgt_v, position=0)
>>> full_k, full_v = kvcache.get_kv(position=0)
>>> print(full_k.shape, full_v.shape)
torch.Size([2, 2, 4, 4]) torch.Size([2, 2, 4, 4])
>>> kvcache.clear()
>>> print(kvcache.src_len, kvcache.tgt_len)
0 0
clear()[source]
get_kv(position)[source]
update_source(key, value)[source]
update_target(key, value, position)[source]
